intro: Psychotria platoensis, commonly known as the Platonic Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale green flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when mature. Psychotria platoensis is often found in humid, shaded environments such as cloud forests.
